name: Description - Ensure design is complete and "Issued For Construction" (IFC) drawings are accurate, complete, and approved by GSI Engineer & GSI Management
Description - Confirm all material intended for use in the works comply with design specification, have been ordered, and will be available on site when required
Responsible Person - GSI Construction Manager / Site Engineer
Description - Load test schedule, test locations and test sheets are reviewed and approved by GSI Engineer and Engineer to contract
Frequency - Prior to start on site
Record Required - Engineer to contract agreement in writing
Notes - Hard copy of standard held on site
Description - Ensure load testing equipment is calibrated and calibration certificates supplied to Engineer to contract for review
Frequency - Prior to start on site
Record Required - Engineer to contract receipt
Notes - Hard copy of standard held on site
Description - Slope assessment completed and reviewed by GSI Project Manager
Frequency - Prior to start on site
Description - Confirm site extents agreed with Engineer and aligns with general intent of the design
Frequency - Prior to start on site
Record Required - Written confirmation to design team
Description - Sacrificial test nail number and locations agreed and approved by GSI PDE/BBO/Earthtec
Frequency - Prior to start on site
Record Required - Engineer to contract agreement in writing
Description - Pre-construction sign off - Subcontract agreement signed, TMP approved, all staff and subcontractors inducted, CMP reveiwed and in place
Frequency - Prior to start on site
Notes - Document reviewed and signed off by site staff and required management .
Description - Permit to Work/Excavate - Confirm location and extent of works, notify service authorities, locate underground services where applicable, notify Worksafe of notifiable works
Description - Plant - Ensure plant suitable for use on site and calibration up to date.  Rig capable of reaching all anchor locations, sufficient wire rope and rig anchoring equipment
A11 - HOLD POINT - NO WORK TO COMMENCE UNLESS THESE ARE COMPLETE
Description - Check Erosion & Sediment Controls are in place and adequate
Description - Establish lay down area and suitable protection of property (ply wood, tarps etc) and bunding around grout unit/refuelling areas as required
Record Required - Photos. Note on Pre-Start form
Description - Check slope stability, area is safe to work in for slope remediation crews (WAH permit in place)
Frequency - Daily prior to accessing lower levels
Record Required - Photos. Note on Pre-Start form
Description - Notify tenants / land users below work site of intended work and likely duration
Record Required - Note on Pre-Start form
Notes - Door knock and face to face discussion required.
Description - Completed installation of approved rope access anchor points as required
Record Required - Photos. Note on Pre-Start form
Description - Before You Dig completed.  Identify and mark location of any existing services including probing, potholing and survey as required
Responsible Person - Project Engineer and Site supervisor
Record Required - Written confirmation to client
Notes - Install offset pegs, mark on drawings
Description - Site markout - GSI Engineer, GSI PDE and Engineer to contract to agree on nail and test nail set out plan
Responsible Person - GSI Project Engineer & GSI PDE
Record Required - Engineer to contract agreement in writing
Notes - Install offset pegs, mark on drawings
B8 - HOLD POINT - NO WORK TO COMMENCE UNLESS THESE ARE COMPLETE
Record Required - Permit signed and valid
Record Required - Daily Equipment Pre-start form completed by operator
Description - Safety audit completed when trimming/scaling slope - not to impact people or property below slope
Record Required - Aduit results sent to PM
Description - Levels and extents of devegatation and slope trimming marked and checked
Responsible Person - Project engineer and site supervisor
Description - GSI Engineer / GSI PM to sign off on completed vegatation and slope trimming
Responsible Person - GSI PDE and GSI PM
C6 - HOLD POINT - NO WORK TO COMMENCE UNLESS THESE ARE COMPLETE
Record Required - Daily Equipment Pre-start form completed by operator
Record Required - Permit signed by operator and Site Superivisor and valid
Description - Confirm cement/water mix ratio including number bags cement needed versus water capacity of mixer
Specification Reference - Confirm ratio / IFC drawings / Specification
Notes - Engineer to contract to confirm in writing
Description - Drill methodology approved by GSI PDE/GSI Engineer and Engineer to contract confirmed following review of proof test results
Frequency - Prior to production nail installation
Notes - Engineer to contract to confirm in writing
D5 - HOLD POINT - Ensure soil nail setout is in accordance with the drawings and approved by BBO/Earthtec
Responsible Person - Project Manager / GSI PDE
Record Required - Written confirmation to client
Description - Confirm drill depth, angle and orientation of soil nails - per IFC drawings
Description - Ensure grout sample cubes or cylinders are available and ready for use (4 per day of grouting)
Specification Reference - GSI grout sampling procedure
Notes - All GSI staff to review updated Grout Samplign SOP prior to start of works
• Install sacrifical anchors: 1 x 9m anchor and 1 x 6m anchor with Grouted Bond Length of 4m ONLY.
• Anchors to be installed with 16mm tremmie line, with centralizers every 1.5m.  Locations to be confirmed by GSI Engineer and Engineer to contract (per B7).
Record Required - Photo, Test result sheet
Notes - Results to be reviewed by GSI Engineer and Engineer to contract
• Drill logs (fully) complete, including hole ID, diameter and length of hole drilled - as well as geology i.e. colour, type (rock/soil), moisture (i.e. dry, slightly moist, wet).
• Ensure to stipulate which holes are to be used for test anchors - based on B7.
Record Required - Photo, Test result sheet
Notes - Results to be reviewed by GSI Engineer and Engineer to contract
• Anchor testing to follow NZTA 2226 TS test schedule at min 7 days after install. For both 6m and 9m anchors.
• Pullout Creep test per NZTA 2226 TS test schedule i.e. 60 min creep test at 110kN. If pullout has not occurred at 150kN, proceed to next load. Do not exceed 250kN.
Record Required - Photo, Test result sheet
Notes - Results to be reviewed by GSI Engineer and Engineer to contract
D11 - HOLD POINT - NO WORK TO COMMENCE UNTIL SACRIFICAL TEST RESULTS REVIEWED BY ENGINEER
• Install 78 no Anchors, in a top down methodology, 18 x 9m RB32 (top row) Anchors, 58 x 6m RB32 anchors. Anchors to be installed with 16mm tremmie line, with centralizers every 1.5m.

• Suitability testing on 5% of installed nails to 150% design working load.  2 x 9m and 3 x 6m suitability anchors to have 1m temporary debonded length for suitability testing.  Locations to be confirmed by GSI Engineer and Engineer to contract (per B7).
Record Required - Photo, Test result sheet
Notes - Results to be reviewed by GSI Engineer and Engineer to contract
D13 - HOLD POINT - NO WORK TO COMMENCE UNTIL SUITABILITY TEST RESULTS REVIEWED BY ENGINEER
Description - Acceptance testing on 25% of installed nails to 100% design working load
Record Required - Photo, Test result sheet
Notes - Results to be reviewed by Engineer to the contract and GSI Engineer
• Grout sampling to follow relevant SOP i.e. tamping down in 1/3 lifts, and stored in supplied chilly bin after initial 12 hours of curing.
• Temperature in chilly bin is to remain as constant as practicable (avoid uneccesarily opening lid).
Specification Reference - GSI grout sampling procedures
Description - Grout samples to be delivered to the lab within 2 days of sampling, where practicable, or as soon as possible thereafter.
Specification Reference - GSI grout sampling procedures
Description - Grout mud balance testing - per relevant SOP
Frequency - Per hour during grouting session
Specification Reference - GSI grout sampling procedures
• Grout logs i.e. number of grout bags per hole and total.
• Volumes to be recorded for each sol nail anchor.
• Ensure nails are appropriately numbered with relevant ID.
Responsible Person - Batching Operator and Project Engineer
• Where necessary, dry pack grout behind plates where grout not in contact with plate. Ensure temporary debonded sections of acceptance test nails are topped up.
• Update grout logs with those test nails that have been topped up.
Description - Soil nail sacrifical, suitability and acceptance tests complete (as above) - per IFC drawings/NZTA 2226 specification
Frequency - 2 nails, 5% of nails (or min. 5), and 25% of nails
D21 - HOLD POINT - NO WORK TO COMMENCE UNLESS THESE ARE COMPLETE
E. TECCO Mesh, Spider Plate and Bio Coir
Description - Confirm extents of mesh to be installed
Responsible Person - GSI Project Engineer and Site Supervisor
Description - Confirm that depressions for spike plates have been SUITABLY excavated around nail collars.
Description - TECCO mesh installed as per manufacturers guidelines.  Ensure wire ropes are installed on top and bottom edges of mesh and tensioned appropriately.
Description - Cirtex Bio-Core installed as per manufacturers guidelines.
E5 - HOLD POINT - NO WORK TO COMMENCE UNLESS THESE ARE COMPLETE
Record Required - Drill and grout logs
Description - Sacrificial, Suitability and Acceptance test nails
Notes - 7 and 14 day results are indicative only
Responsible Person - Site Supervisor and Project Engineer
Close out - Sign and Date When Action Complete
